article:
A Kentucky young man was taken to a hospital and then to country prison after leading police on a one-hour freeway chase   in a stolen SUV . The chase    ended  in downtown Los Angeles in front of the
Spring Hotel. Most of the chase was  _  , except for an
empty  _  of wine that the driver threw at one police
vehicle.
When the driver got into downtown,   _  started to happen. He ran over a
fire hydrant . The water poured out of the hydrant,   _  all
the books in several carts   that a seller had put outside to   _  customers into his bookstore. The driver  _  turned west onto Grand Avenue and managed to knock into
three  _  cars on one side of that street and two cars on the
other side. The driver also tried to run over  a police officer  , who was
standing in the  crosswalk  ordering him to stop.
Turning north, the driver caused a bus to hit its   _  to avoid a crash. The
bus was empty, and the bus driver was uninjured.  _  , two police
cars that were chasing the SUV  _  different
directions were not so  _  . One of them ran into the front
of the bus, and the other into the back.  _  the drivers had
braked early enough, the damage to their cars was  _  . Both
officers continued the chase.
They only went two   _  north to find that the SUV had come to a full stop
because it had  _  into a newspaper stand in front of the
Spring Hotel. The driver  _  heavily behind the steering
wheel . The police   _  the driver of failure to give in
to a police officer.
